content: stitches used in this pattern knit k purl p knit 2 stitches together k2tog and right front cross rfc right front cross rfc worked over 3 stitches as follows 1 insert right needle into the third stitch from the tip of the left needle as to knit pull a loop of yarn through but do not slide any stitches off of the left hand needle 2 insert right needle into the stitch closest to the tip of the left needle knit and slide off left needle as usual 3 knit next stitch originally second from the tip now closest to the tip and slide it and the first stitch knit chunky dean street hat originally the third stitch from the tip of the left needle a nina machlin dayton design off the left needle there is a photo tutorial for this stitch at the end of this a unisex cabled hat in three sizes with two pattern alternate brims 4 row cable stitch pattern sizes directions are written for size small baby row 1 2 and 4 * p1 k3* repeat from * to * across changes for medium adult s and large adult l row are written in parentheses the stitch pattern has a row 3 * p1 rfc over next 3 sts * repeat from * to * across row lot of stretch so finished measurements do not equate with head size and each size can fit a lot of brim co 60 72 84 stitches on #9 16 circular different head measurements approximate head needles place marker and being careful not to twist sizes fit small 15-18 medium 18-22 large 20- the stitches join and knit in the round work one of the 24 depending on how tight or loose the wearer two brims below as directed likes their hats to be brim #1 rolled brim k 4 row switch to #10 16 yarn 80 95 104 yards chunky/bulky weight yarn circular needles and k 3 row for a total of 7 k row samples are made from malabrigo yarns chunky needles 1 set each us 9/5 5mm 16- inch circular us brim #2 ribbed brim - *p1 k1* repeat from * to * 10/6mm 16-inch circular us 10/6mm double pointed across row please note that this 1/1 ribbing starts with other materials tapestry needle stitch marker a p stitch and not a k stitch as usual for ribbing work in gauge 18 sts to 4 in 4 row cable stitch pattern un- ribbing for 1 5 inches stretched due to the very stretchy nature of this pattern stitch exact gauge is not as crucial as in other body of hat switch to #10 16-inch circular needle stitch patterns be sure that your gauge is close to this and to 4 row cable stitch pattern and work evenly until if it is off by a lot it can adversely affect the fit of the 4 ½ 5 5 ½ inches from beginning or 3 inches less hat
